search.try-for: You can search for constants, variables, units, formulas and/or equations

universal.title: Universal
universal.lead: Many constants and units are universal in science, here you can find them all in one place.

chemistry.title: Chemistry
chemistry.lead: Chemistry is the scientific discipline involved with elements and compounds composed of atoms, molecules and ions: their composition, structure, properties, behavior and the changes they undergo during a reaction with other substances.

mathematics.title: F√≠sica
mathematics.lead: Mathematics (from Greek: ŒºŒ¨Œ∏Œ∑ŒºŒ±, m√°thƒìma, 'knowledge, study, learning') includes the study of such topics as quantity (number theory), structure (algebra), space (geometry), and change (analysis). It has no generally accepted definition.

physics.title: Physics
physics.lead: Physics (from Ancient Greek: œÜœÖœÉŒπŒ∫ŒÆ (·ºêœÄŒπœÉœÑŒÆŒºŒ∑), romanized: physik·∏ó (epist·∏ómƒì), lit. 'knowledge of nature', from œÜœçœÉŒπœÇ ph√Ωsis 'nature') is the natural science that studies matter, its motion and behavior through space and time, and the related entities of energy and force. Physics is one of the most fundamental scientific disciplines, and its main goal is to understand how the universe behaves.

constants.title: Constants
constants.lead: A fixed and well-defined number or other non-varying mathematical object. The terms mathematical constant or physical constant are sometimes used to distinguish this meaning.

equations.title: Equations
equations.lead: In mathematics, an equation is a statement that asserts the equality of two expressions, which are connected by the equals sign "=".

formulas.title: Formulas
formulas.lead: In science, a formula is a concise way of expressing information symbolically, as in a mathematical formula or a chemical formula. The informal use of the term formula in science refers to the general construct of a relationship between given quantities.

units.title: Units
units.lead: A unit of measure is a standardized quantity of a certain physical quantity, defined and adopted by convention or by law.Any value of a physical quantity can be expressed as a multiple of the unit of measure.

variables.title: Variables
variables.lead: A variable is a symbol which works as a placeholder for expression or quantities that may vary or change; is often used to represent the argument of a function or an arbitrary element of a set. In addition to numbers, variables are commonly used to represent vectors, matrices and functions.

favorites.title: Favorites
favorites.lead: Your favorites are stored locally in the browser so no data is saved.
favorites.no-support: Your browser does not support local storage function üòî, consider using another browser for this feature.

report.title: Report this page
report.lead: Reporting errors are very important for us, thank you for taking your time to do it!
report.input-placeholder-reason: Tell us what did you find... üòß

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.lead: In this page you can find some of the *possible* questions you can have about Equreka

why-is-free.question: Why is it free?
why-is-free.anwser: As we stated in the page about: knowledge should be free, open, easily accessible and if can be, as easy to understand as possible.

why-no-signup.question: Why don't there is no user signup?
why-no-signup.anwser: We live in a world where most platforms, sites or apps require a form of authentication, whether by creating an account or registration through a social network, where there is no transparency, there is no clarity or there are always small letters difficult to see, to know how they will handle our data that is collected. There have been many leaks from large companies and guaranteeing said security is a very difficult task. Equreka does not need any type of information from you, we will not collect data on our servers, we handle APIs directly in the browser that are stored on your computer and that you can see what information is being stored on YOUR computer.
